Package org.jtrim2.collections

Interface RefCollection.ElementRef<E>

Type Parameters:
E - the type of the referenced element
All Known Subinterfaces:
RefList.ElementRef<E>
Enclosing interface:
RefCollection<E>
public static interface RefCollection.ElementRef<E>
Defines a reference to an element of a RefCollection. The reference remains valid no matter how the underlying collection was modified.

Thread safety

Instances of this class derive their thread-safety properties from the underlying collection.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    E
    getElement()
    Returns the element of the underlying collection stored by this reference.
    boolean
    isRemoved()
    Checks whether this element reference is still part of the underlying collection or not.
    void
    remove()
    Removes this element reference from the underlying collection.
    E
    setElement(E newElement)
    Replaces the element referenced by this reference.

  • Method Details

    • setElement

      E setElement(E newElement)
      Replaces the element referenced by this reference. This method will actually modify the content of the underlying collection.

      This method works even if this element reference was already removed from the collection. Even in this case the getElement method can be used to retrieve the value set by this method.

      Parameters:
      newElement - the new value which will replace the currently stored element. Subsequent getElement() method call will return this value. This argument can be null only if the underlying collection supports null elements.
      Returns:
      the previous value which was replaced by this method call. This method may return null if the underlying collection supports null elements.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - thrown if this collection does not support null elements
      UnsupportedOperationException - thrown if the underlying collection is read-only and so it cannot be modified

    • getElement

      E getElement()
      Returns the element of the underlying collection stored by this reference.

      This method will work even after this reference was removed from the underlying collection.

      Returns:
      the element of the underlying collection stored by this reference. This method may return null if the underlying collection supports null elements.

    • isRemoved

      boolean isRemoved()
      Checks whether this element reference is still part of the underlying collection or not. Once this method returns true, subsequent calls will always return true because the reference cannot be reinserted into the underlying collection.

      After this element was removed, updating this reference will have no effect on the underlying collection (since there will be no underlying collection). Note however, that the referenced element is still accessible through this element reference.

      Returns:
      true if this element reference is no longer part of the underlying collection, false otherwise

    • remove

      void remove()
      Removes this element reference from the underlying collection. The element referenced by this reference will no longer be part of the underlying collection.

      This method call is idempotent, that is once this reference was removed, removing it again has no effect.

      After this element was removed, updating this reference will have no effect on the underlying collection (since there will be no underlying collection). Note however, that the referenced element is still accessible through this element reference. So even after this method call the setElement(E) and getElement() methods will still work.
